column4: hi, I have a ubuntu system in which I accidentally zero'd the first 7 sectors. Can someone tell me what partition ID ubuntu uses by default?
its the standard one anyway, iirc 82 is linux 83 is linux swap
had it backwards sorry, 83 is linux and 82 is linux swap
well I don't have any other linux sstems handy :)
good luck determing what the partitioning was setup as though
if your system is still booted in linux you can probably figure it out, otherwise it might be somewhat hard
I need to rewrite the MBR & boot loader
so you'll have to guess at how many partitions and the exact geometry then
I downloaded Stellar Phoenix demo and it found the data partition
I don't recall the swap size but I did a bog standard mythbuntu install
oh ok, well glad it found the partition for you :)
